essay.question-text: The professor describes some accomplishments of Darwin and Einstein. Explain how this information about Darwin and Einstein is related to the information about establishing new ideas.
essay.sample-answer-text:
SAMPLE ANSWER
In this set of materials, the reading passage discusses the difficulty of introducing new scientific ideas, and the professor describes two well-known scientists who faced this difficulty.
The reading passage explains why it is difficult to establish new scientific ideas. It is difficult to do this because established theories are the norm and new theories are suspect. Many scientists who are accepted today were not accepted when they started out, and many scientists who are not accepted today may become accepted later.
In the talk, the professor provides two examples of scientists whose ideas were initially viewed skeptically and were later admitted. One of the examples is Darwin and his ideas on natural selection; the other example is Einstein and his ideas on relativity.
